column5: Catching 18 whistlin' trout...       Beauty of a day and good times !!!
Now dont tell me,I know that fella there,just give me a minute,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,Is it red green? LOL  Beauty of a day for a couple of retired fellas to sit and catch fish Norm. TFS.

It was a wonderful way to spend a morning with a good friend, the fish were just a bonus and the tree I caught has to have set some kind of a record for length but it didn't put up much of a fight. Beans never even offered to net it for me (well, actually I think he did ask if I wanted the net, this post will get edited if I try to repeat what I told him LOL).
A beautiful day spent soaking up the spring sunshine and telling fish tales. Can't beat that!!!
sure is a great way to spend a spring day
~~~I call them Bugle Trouts, wish I could get out midweek
Cliff's tree...try filleting one of these...  ...6 lb. mono...new record ?      Hey OP...we kinda save the "bugle" for carp...as in" Bugle-mouthed bass"...

Good stuff guys!  Those whistle trout sure do fight don't they?? And those branches...wow....they've broken many a leader in my time...great job on landing that monster!  LOL.  Gotta love it when you don't need to dress in layers, or wear a float suit, battle frozen fingers and noses, and all that stuff.
